title: Maryland gun control law is latest answer to Supreme Court ruling
description: Legislators and judges across US are grappling with top court's ruling, which has been used to challenge restrictions.

title: Elon Musk warns of tough economy, says Tesla not immune
description: At Tesla's annual shareholder meeting, Musk said Tesla would advertise its cars, something it has never done before.

title: US denounces arrest of former consulate employee in Russia
description: Robert Shonov is being held for allegedly cooperating 'on a confidential basis' with a foreign organisation.

title: Inter win Milan derby 1-0 to reach Champions League final
description: Inter cruise past AC Milan 3-0 on aggregate to reach first Champions League final since lifting the trophy in 2010.

title: What to expect as the US continues with debt ceiling negotiations
description: Republican lawmakers continue to insist on cuts to social programmes as US debt default looms on the horizon.

title: One dead, 23 missing after hippo hits boat in Malawi river
description: The vessel, a canoe, was carrying 37 people across the Shire River when the incident took place.

title: Impeachment hearing begins in Ecuador against President Lasso
description: Lasso could trigger 'two-way death' clause in constitution, dissolving both the legislature and ending his presidency.

title: Pakistani government to try violent protesters under army laws
description: People were seen burning and attacking police, gov't buildings, official and public vehicles, and military assets.

title: Will the pro-democracy opposition take power in Thailand?
description: Parties challenging military secured a significant general election victory and promise major reforms.

title: Turkey slams election observers’ ‘lack of transparency’ comment
description: Ankara says remarks made in a report on Sunday's polls by European observers are 'politically charged and accusatory'.

title: Key takeaways from investigation of FBI’s Trump-Russia probe
description: US special counsel John Durham examined the FBI's 2016 investigation of possible Trump campaign collusion with Russia.

title: Five German gang members sentenced for Green Vault jewel heist
description: The thieves looted goods worth more than 113 million euros ($123m) from the Green Vault in Dresden in 2019.

title: Man City vs Real Madrid: Champions League semifinal preview
description: Manchester City slight favourites for the second leg at the Etihad after salvaging a 1-1 first leg draw in Madrid.

title: France issues arrest warrant for Lebanon’s central bank chief
description: Riad Salameh calls the warrant a violation of law as he is investigated over corruption allegations at home and abroad.

title: Former UFC heavyweight champion Francis Ngannou signs with PFL
description: The 36-year-old ex-UFC heavyweight champion will fight exclusively for the Professional Fighters League in new deal.

title: Mausoleum of football legend Pele opens to public in Brazil
description: Two golden statues of the three-time World Cup winner welcomes visitors to tomb in Santos.

title: ‘A huge inspiration’: Embiid’s NBA MVP and Cameroon’s hoop dreams
description: The NBA MVP is a hero in Cameroon, and the country's talented but struggling game could use some of his stardust.

title: Ukraine Supreme Court chief detained in $2.7m graft probe
description: Ukraine, while at war with Russia, reels from 'biggest-ever case' implicating the judiciary.

title: Women speak out online about reports of sexual violence in Sudan
description: Women have taken to social media to call out, and warn others about reported rapes being perpetrated by soldiers.

title: CIA urges Russians to get in touch, Moscow puts spies on alert
description: US agency publishes video asking Russians to leak information which could be 'more valuable than you think'.

title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off amid anti-government protests
description: Amid France's pension reform protests and controversies against Johnny Depp, the 76th edition of the festival kicks off.

title: In Brazil, prisons without guards offer inmates path to recovery
description: Facilities run by a local non-profit focus on rehabilitation over punishment, in a method that has expanded worldwide.

title: Libya parliament suspends rival eastern-based PM Bashagha
description: Prime Minister Fathi Bashagha suspended by parliament and his duties handed over to his finance minister.

title: Senegal opposition leader Ousmane Sonko’s rape trial adjourned
description: Ousmane Sonko, who denies charges, does not turn up for court appearance in Dakar.

title: As Turkey heads to a presidential election run-off, what’s next?
description: Analysts say incumbent candidate Recep Tayyip Erdogan has an edge over the opposition's Kemal Kilicdaroglu.

title: Dead woman wins civic election in India’s Uttar Pradesh: Report
description: Ashiya Bi wins municipal poll almost two weeks after death as supporters keep pledge to back her as a sign of respect.

title: In Romania, Ukrainian children with special needs struggle
description: Providing and accessing therapy is increasingly challenging given a lack of funding, bureaucracy, and language barriers.

title: In Turkey’s elections, nationalism is the real winner
description: In both the pro-government and opposition camps, nationalists are key and rising in popularity.

title: Want to beat Trump in 2024? Learn from E Jean Carroll
description: Democrats need to put the tissues and tantrums away, and fight the way Carroll did, if they are to defeat Trump.

title: At least 16 killed as Pakistan tribes clash over coal mine
description: Officials say incident is part of decades-old tribal rivalry over mine in Darra Adam Khel area of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

title: Sudan: To break the cycle of violence, end the kleptocracy
description: Vested economic interests are fuelling the conflict in Sudan. They must be addressed in the peace-building effort.

title: China detains South Korea footballer in suspected bribery case
description: Son Jun-ho, who plays in the Chinese league, is under investigation for allegedly accepting a bribe, officials say.

title: Bangladesh rocked by power cuts as Cyclone Mocha hits fuel supply
description: The country faces its worst power cuts in months as the deadly storm forces closure of both its floating LNG terminals.

title: Fleeing Sudan: ‘I had to do it for my daughter’
description: Hamsa Alfaki shares her experience of having to leave her father in Khartoum as she fled for the border with Egypt.

title: EU to curb Indian fuel imports made with Russian oil: Report
description: The EU's foreign policy chief has called for a crackdown of Russian oil into Europe as refined fuel, including diesel.

title: Photos: Sudanese capital devastated by a month of brutal fighting
description: Nearly a million displaced and more than 1,000 people killed as civilians bear the brunt of war that erupted last month.

title: ‘The longest and loudest shelling in Kyiv since the war began’
description: Journalist Mansur Mirovalev woke up to the sound of loud bangs in Kyiv as Russia unleashed a heavy air attack.

title: Burundi-born ex-policeman seeks to become Greece’s first Black MP
description: Spiros Richard Hagabimana's win in the May 21 vote would be historic in Greece where few migrants hold official posts.

title: Six dead after fire engulfs hostel in Wellington, New Zealand
description: The cause of the fire is not known, but emergency services are treating the incident as suspicious.

title: Disbelief in Diyarbakir as Turkey heads for presidential runoff
description: Turkey's Kurdish-majority southeast voted overwhelmingly for Kilicdaroglu, but it wasn't enough to beat Erdogan.

title: US asks India to check ‘continued targeted attacks’ on minorities
description: State Department's report on religious freedom lists attacks on Muslims and Christians in world's most populous nation.

title: Map: Which countries still have the death penalty?
description: The number of recorded executions has risen to its highest level in five years, according to Amnesty International.

title: Silencing dissent: Journalists in Sudan face threats, raids
description: Media workers say they're being intimated by warring forces on both sides for reporting human rights violations.

title: Qatar and Bahrain to resume flights on May 25
description: The Gulf countries announced a restoration of ties in April, resolving a dispute dating back to 2017.

title: How are cities responding to extreme heat?
description: Risks include increased death and illness, threats to biodiversity and long-term impacts on economic growth.

title: Oil giant ExxonMobil settles long-running Indonesia torture case
description: The trial in the 22-year-old case brought by villagers in Aceh province was due to start next week.

title: Cyclone Mocha may have killed ‘hundreds’ in Myanmar’s Rakhine
description: Communications problems are making it difficult to assess the extent of the damage caused by the massive storm.

title: Palestine’s Abbas calls on UN to ‘suspend’ Israel as Nakba marked
description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas insists that Israel must respect UN resolutions on Palestine or cease as UN member.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 447
description: As the war enters its 447th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Are killer robots the future of war?
description: They could transform the battlefield but is the world ready for machines that decide who to kill? No, say many nations.

title: S Africa army chief visits Moscow in wake of US weapons claim
description: Visit to Moscow follows US allegations that weapons were loaded on to a Russian ship in Cape Town in December.

title: US releases nuclear warhead data in bid to pressure Russia
description: Disclosure under New START Treaty follows Russia's decision to suspend its participation in the nuclear agreement.

title: Singapore’s death row ‘main element of its drug policy’
description: Dozens of people face hanging for drug offences in Singapore with no sign the city-state will soften its approach.

title: Recorded executions rise to highest in five years: Amnesty
description: In annual report, rights group says 'killing spree' was led by countries in the Middle East and North Africa.

title: Air raid alerts sound across Ukraine, Kyiv repels aerial attack
description: At least 10 explosions heard by witnesses in Kyiv as officials say a Russian air attack was under way.

title: US teen kills 3 in New Mexico before shot dead by police
description: No motive was readily apparent as to why the 18-year-old gunman shot three people dead before he was killed by police.
